definition: a funeral/to encoffin a corpse/to carry to burial
building/shop/term for certain service establishments/embassy or consulate/schoolroom (old)/CL:家[jia1]

sentences.english: Their reception, including dinner and dancing, also was held there.
sentences.chinese: 他們的婚宴，包括宴會與舞會，也是在殯儀館舉行。

sentences.english: Sato said local authorities may ask foreign funeral homes to send supplies.
sentences.chinese: 佐藤說，當地政府已經向國外的殯儀館請求發送物資。

sentences.english: A traditional funeral home wanted to charge her $3, 200.
sentences.chinese: 一家傳統的殯儀館打算收取她3200美元。

sentences.english: After we moved to the funeral parlour, we continued to chant into the night.
sentences.chinese: 在我們移靈殯儀館之後，我們整夜爲他念誦。

sentences.english: His ashes were placed in the Martyr Mausoleum Hall of the Funeral Parlor of Hegang – his second homeland.
sentences.chinese: 他的骨灰被放到了第二故鄉鶴崗殯儀館烈士陵堂。

sentences.english: Funeral directors will always have jobs.
sentences.chinese: 殯儀館館長永遠都會有工作。

sentences.english: Make sure images match color swatches.
sentences.chinese: 請務必彩色圖像匹配殯儀館。

sentences.english: The access road adjacent to the diamond hill funeral parlour leading to sze chen hall of diamond hill crematorium.
sentences.chinese: 毗連鑽石山殯儀館，通往鑽石山火葬場思親堂的通路。

sentences.english: But I don't see a funeral home; I see an events center.
sentences.chinese: 但我不認爲這是殯儀館，我把它當作活動中心。

sentences.english: As quiet as the funeral parlor had been.
sentences.chinese: 這種靜寂就像殯儀館中的寧靜。

sentences.english: He awakened and dressed again in black and returned to the parlor.
sentences.chinese: 他醒來，穿上喪服，回到殯儀館。

sentences.english: The mortician was surprised to find scars from wounds and a withered leg.
sentences.chinese: 殯儀館的人驚訝地發現他身上累累的傷疤和萎縮的腿。

sentences.english: The access road adjacent to the diamond hill funeral parlour leading to sze chen hall of diamond hill crematorium .
sentences.chinese: 毗連鑽石山殯儀館，通往鑽石山火葬場思親堂的通路。

definition: to pass (sth) on (to sb else)/to transfer sb (to another hospital etc)
unable to move freely/difficult to get about
